concise_definition: adj. 假的, 伪造的; n. 假货, 伪造品; v. 伪造, 假装

definitions.explanation_en: Not genuine or real; deliberately made to appear authentic but actually counterfeit or misleading.
definitions.explanation_cn: 非真实的；故意制造得看似真实，实为伪造或具有误导性的。
definitions.example_en: She was wearing a fake diamond necklace that looked identical to the real one.
definitions.example_cn: 她戴着一条假钻石项链，看起来和真的一模一样。

definitions.explanation_en: An imitation or counterfeit object designed to deceive others into believing it is genuine.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一种为欺骗他人而制造的仿制品，使其误以为是真品。
definitions.example_en: The museum discovered several fakes among the newly acquired artifacts.
definitions.example_cn: 博物馆在新购入的文物中发现了几件赝品。

definitions.explanation_en: To pretend or simulate something, often to deceive or gain an advantage.
definitions.explanation_cn: 假装或模拟某种情况，通常是为了欺骗或获取优势。
definitions.example_en: He faked an injury to avoid playing in the match.
definitions.example_cn: 他假装受伤以逃避参加比赛。

definitions.explanation_en: To create a counterfeit version of something, especially for financial or fraudulent purposes.
definitions.explanation_cn: 制造某物的伪造版本，尤其是出于财务或欺诈目的。
definitions.example_en: They were arrested for faking signatures on legal documents.
definitions.example_cn: 他们因伪造法律文件上的签名而被逮捕。

comparison.analysis: “False” (虚假的) 更侧重于与事实或真实情况相悖，常用于陈述、信息或判断的不真实，如 false statement（虚假陈述）。而 “fake” 更强调人为制造的仿冒品或伪装行为，具有更强的欺骗性和物质性。
“Counterfeit” (伪造的) 通常特指非法复制货币、证件或品牌商品，具有明确的法律违法性，语义更正式、更严重。而 “fake” 是更口语化、通用的词，可涵盖从玩具到身份的广泛仿冒物，不一定涉及法律犯罪。
“Artificial” (人造的) 指非自然产生的，但不一定具有欺骗意图，如 artificial sweetener（人工甜味剂）或 artificial intelligence（人工智能）。它强调来源而非真假；而 “fake” 则隐含故意误导的意图，强调‘冒充真实’。
